content: I've seen in a bunch of places text like ...
The parser and lexer are currently undergoing a lot of refactoring, so parts of this chapter may be out of date.
I'm a bit opposed to have this kind of text but wanted to also hear opinions from others

the thing is ... everything at some point in time is under a lot of refactoring and always parts of the guide may be out of date, in particular I'm pretty sure that sections that are not up to date doesn't have a disclaimer like that

I guess I'd rather have just a disclaimer at the beginning of the guide, saying that parts of the guide may not reflect the actual content of the guide rather than spreading a ton of notes like this through the different chapters

Santiago Pastorino said:

I guess I'd rather have just a disclaimer at the beginning of the guide, saying that parts of the guide may not reflect the actual content of the guide rather than spreading a ton of notes like this through the different chapters

sounds good to me :)

I guess we had added these in places where there was huge amounts of change meaning that part of the chapter may be completely outdated or in need of replacement (as opposed to normal refactoring or churn). I'm not opposed to removing them, but I'm not that bothered by them either
I think for such caveats, it would be best to point to a project or wg that hopefully is documenting the change process.

How about text such as "As of <date or commit>, ... <the described situation>" ?
I don't think all chapters/sections should have that wording, but it might be a better alternative to "this might be out of date"
I do like the idea of adding more specific messages, such as "as of <date or commit>" or a list of relevant commits/chat topics for people to refer to as mentioned above by @Jubilee
